result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrie D Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

superMiscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Participate in counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate, including anger management.   Follow through with recommendations.  No contact, directly or indirectly, with co-actor.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations, including aftercare programming.

ALONG WITH $2,500.00 CO-SIGNATURE BOND TO BE SIGNED WITH HIS MOTHER, PAMELA MARE, DOB 09-11-1970 WITH PHOTO ID. Ct 1: 941.30(1)-First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Use of Dangerous Weapon; Ct 2: 946.41(1)-Obstructing; Ct 3: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony Bail Jumping. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  Defendant must be compliant with all rules of his mother's home. Mother is to contact this Court if there are any violations of her rules. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Status conference on October 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Demetrie D Harris in court with attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Defendant Demetrie D Harris in custody.  James D. Newlun appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is asking for $2,500.00 cash and $2,500.00 co-signature bond with his mother, Mare 09-11-1970.  
The State is strongly opposed to bond modification, citing deft's criminal history and charges pending not only in Racine but in Columbia Co. as well.

BTC: Motion to modify bond is granted. $2,500.00 cash along with $2,500.00 co-signature to be signed with mother, Pamela Mare DOB 09-11-1970. Conditions are to be as previously ordered as well as the condition that deft must be compliant with rules of mother's home. Deft's mother is to contact this Court of any violations.
